availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p:
Paris Ky Aug 11th 64
Saml Williams Esqr
Dr Sir

Your of 8th inst to N. B. Rion is before me, I think you need give yourself no trouble about any presentment before Grand Jury, that thing is played out, Our town is full to overflowing with such desirable Citizens, Sir Robbins health is good & his character remains unimpeached, He is orderly, quiet, & unassuming, Short time since enquired for you, I wrote you last spring & directed to Flemingsburg -- not knowing your address, I collected the debt in Southern Ky -- of Heater Porter & Read, one of them is dead, I think Porter, Mr R wrote to me to send the note to Louisville, I done so & it was paid with 6% -- Mr R is a perfect gentleman, I paid as follows. Rion & Mitchell in full Garrett & Spears in full & the bal to Massie -- I have just looked for the memorandum but failed to find it -- I stated the diferent Amts in my former letter, buissiness is dull, no chance for employment
at this time, Sam I would like to see you much very much & can say the same for Dr Ingles,
Let me hear from you soon,
The improvement in your Condition should be Satisfactory -- It is more than I can say.
